name: Side Lying Hip Abduction
how_to_perform:
1. Lie on your side with your legs straight and foot on top of the other, facing upwards.
2. Slowly lift your top leg away from your bottom leg until it is at a 45-degree angle to your body.
3. Hold this position for a brief moment (about 0-1 second).
4. Carefully lower your top leg back down to the starting position.
5. Repeat on the other side by switching legs.

**Note:** Keep your core engaged and your working leg straight throughout the exercise.
short_summary: Side lying hip abduction is an isolation exercise that targets the gluteus medius muscle, helping to strengthen and stabilize the hips, while maintaining good posture.
